results.title: Dark habits = entre tinieblas
results.creator_credit: Luis Calvo, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Tesauro S A and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: Prepare to meet some nuns like you’ve never met before. Junkie nightclub singer Yolanda Bell (Christina S Pascual), takes refuge with the religious order ‘the humble redeemers’, after her boyfriend overdoses on heroin and Yolanda’s on the run from the police. ‘The humble redeemers’ are a good hearted group, trying to save girls from leading a wild life. They do however have a dark side to their operations; dealing drugs, dabbling in pornography and active chain smoking admirers of Cecil Barton. Together they are planning a party to celebrate Mother Superior’s name day; it will be a party to end all parties. Described as an evil twin of films such as ‘Sister act’ and ‘The Sound of music’, this film is Almodovar at his devilish and controversial best. Cast includes Julieta Serrano, Julia Marisa Paredes and Mary Carrillo. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Dark eyes
results.creator_credit: Exelsior Film-TV, Rai Uno Radiotelevisione Italiana, Silvia D'Amico Bendico, Carlo Cucchi and Nikita Mikhalkov
results.brief_description: Romano’s marriage leaves him dissatisfied, until a visit to a spa where he falls in love with a mysterious Russian lady. But when he follows her to Russia, the dream dissolves. Based on Chekhov’s classic ‘Lady with a little dog’, leading Soviet director Nikita Mikhalkov’s first film abroad is richly romantic - and ironic. Mastroianni plays the Chekhovian anti-hero to perfection, supported by a magnificent Italian and Russian cast. Mastroianni won the Best Actor award at Cannes in 1987 for his performance. Also stars Silvana Mangano. Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Dark days [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Wide Angle Pictures, Palm Pictures, Picture Farm and Marc Singer
results.brief_description: In “Dark days”, first-time filmmaker Marc Singer has documented the lives of the tunnel-dwellers living in deserted segments of New York’s subway network. Shot in stark black and white and illuminated by a single spotlight, we follow the journey of these dignified and articulate characters from the homeless drudgery of the tunnel to public housing above the ground, which offers some hope for the future. Along the way they strive to overcome drug addiction, rat infestation, and chronic destitution, not to mention tension in their relationships with fellow inhabitants; all while maintaining a strength which shatters society’s myths of homelessness. The tunnel- dwellers acted not only as the subjects for this documentary, but also producers and crewmembers, fighting for their voice to be heard and their story to be told. Featuring a soundtrack by DJ Shadow, “Dark days” is a moving and very human portrayal of life in the bowels of the western world.

results.title: Dark city [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dark City Productions, Andrew Mason and Alex Proyas
results.brief_description: Emanating from the same Fox studios as ‘The Matrix’, Alex Proyas’ ‘Dark City’ has the same impressive array of special effects and a rather enigmatic plot. The film begins with an amnesiac John Murdoch (Rufus Sewell) awakening in a bathtub, with no recollection of why he’s there and a tiny bloodspot on his forehead. Other people around him seem to know more about John’s memory than he does, including his estranged wife Emma (Jennifer Connelly), mad genius Dr Schreber (Kiefer Sutherland) and sympathetic policeman Frank Bumstead (William Hurt). John’s investigation into regaining his memory is set against a bleak film noir inspired background where the sun never rises, as well as a murder investigation into a series of deaths involving prostitutes (of which Murdoch is a suspect) and a former policeman (Colin Friels) who seems to have gone mad investigating the case. Both John’s investigation into his past and the police investigation into the murders are intricately involved with The Strangers - a band of gothic looking people who have a collective memory and have the ability to alter the physical world via a process called Turning - a capability that John possesses. The Strangers are driven by the need to replicate humans and ensure The Strangers survival, begging the question, what is it that makes us human? Cast also includes Richard O’Brien, Ian Richardson, Mitchell Butel, Frank Gallacher and Melissa George.

results.title: Dark circle
results.creator_credit: Independent Documentary Group, Chris Beaver, Judy Irving and Ruth Landy
results.brief_description: This is a contemporary portrait of the nuclear age told through the lives of those directly affected by it. The film is shot on location at the Rocky Flats Nuclear Weapons Facility near Denver, the Diablo Canyon Nuclear Power Plant in central California, and in the cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. “Dark Circle” interweaves dramatic personal stories with rare, recently declassified footage of the secret world in which the hydrogen bomb is manufactured, tested and sold. Four years in the making, this film reveals the ironic and complex human costs of a nuclear economy even in the absence of a nuclear war.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Independent Documentary Group, Chris Beaver, Judy Irving and Ruth Landy

results.title: Dark cave
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Dark Cave (previously `That poured its hot breath’) is an evocation of memory and identity that takes the form of a poetic video diary. Kalin endows intimate ‘home movie’ scenes of travel and personal life with mystery and melancholy. A quote from Alfred Chester serves to destabilize the lyrical nostalgia of the rhythmic images.

results.title: Dark cargoes: the Australian slaving system
results.creator_credit: Lensie Matthews, Greenapple Media and Tony Matthews
results.brief_description: Archival material, descendants of Pacific islanders and historian Robert Dansie recall the foundation of misery upon which the Queensland sugar industry was largely built. The institution of indentured labour by Queensland’s Governor Bowen and wealthy Queensland pastoralists resulted in a slave trade reminiscent of the southern United States before the American Civil War.

results.title: Dark angel
results.creator_credit: Spelling Entertainment, Big Ticket Television, Elisa Kohn Taub and Robert Iscove
results.brief_description: In this made-for-television action thriller, a homicide detective who has been transferred from the Baton Rouge police department to New Orleans under mysterious circumstances is linked to a serial killer who preys on adulterous women. His new superiors assign a female detective to investigate him forcing him to confront his past in order to prove himself innocent before more women are killed. Cast includes Eric Roberts, Ashley Crow, Gina Torres, Linden Ashby.

results.title: Dark angel
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Sidney A. Franklin
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a World War I ravaged England, this superbly acted romantic drama is a true classic. Merle Oberon is a revelation as a reformed vamp torn between two men - Herbert Marshall and Frederic March, the latter having returned from the war blinded. The script was adapted by Lillian Hellman from the play by Guy Bolton (a.k.a R. B. Trevelyan).

results.title: Daria
results.creator_credit: Susie Lewis, Paramount Pictures and MTV
results.brief_description: The unlikely heroine of this offbeat animated MTV series is a cynical and quick witted teenage outsider named Daria Morgendorffer. Her cutting barbs are of course a way of coping with her vacuous teenage sister, her indifferent parents and the cliquey high school she attends which would be complete hell if it wasn’t for her like minded best friend, Jane.
